segment.source: How to turn managed browser hosting controls back on in Internet Explorer 11.
segment.target: How to turn managed browser hosting controls back on in Internet Explorer 11.

segment.source: .NET Framework problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)
segment.target: .NET Framework problems with Internet Explorer 11 (Internet Explorer 11 for IT Pros)

segment.source: If you’re having problems launching your legacy apps while running Internet Explorer 11, it’s most likely because Internet Explorer no longer starts apps that use managed browser hosting controls, like in .NET Framework 1.1 and 2.0.
segment.target: If you’re having problems launching your legacy apps while running Internet Explorer 11, it’s most likely because Internet Explorer no longer starts apps that use managed browser hosting controls, like in .NET Framework 1.1 and 2.0.

segment.source: To turn managed browser hosting controls back on
segment.target: To turn managed browser hosting controls back on

segment.source: For x86 systems or for 32-bit processes on x64 systems: Go to the registry key and change the EnableIEHosting value to 1.
segment.target: For x86 systems or for 32-bit processes on x64 systems: Go to the registry key and change the EnableIEHosting value to 1.

segment.source: For x64 systems or for 64-bit processes on x64 systems: Go to the registry key and change the EnableIEHosting value to 1.
segment.target: For x64 systems or for 64-bit processes on x64 systems: Go to the registry key and change the EnableIEHosting value to 1.

segment.source: For more information, see the Web Applications section of the Application Compatibility in the .NET Framework 4.5 page.
segment.target: For more information, see the Web Applications section of the Application Compatibility in the .NET Framework 4.5 page.
